main event: An unidentified bright light was observed hovering in Feasterville, Pennsylvania on July 25, 1966.
interesting points: The observer noted the light was hovering 20-30 feet above the ground for approximately 2 minutes before it accelerated and disappeared., The object was observed from a distance of about one-half mile., Two policemen also reported seeing three lights in a row on consecutive nights., The report states that the object was saucer-shaped and about the size of a basketball at arm's length., The incident was noted by Richard Greene, a retired Air Force member, who seemed reliable with no signs of emotional disturbance.
sighted object: bright light hovering above the ground
witness description: the observer reported the sighting from a distance
